#Text=Qazi Ghulam Mustafa
#Text=Qazi Ghulam Mustafa
#Text=( died c. 1123 AH / 1711 AD ) was one of the prominent noblemen during the Mughal empire .
#Text=He was entitled ' Kar Talab Khan ' by Bahadur Shah I .
#Text=He was Emir and belonged to Ferozepur Jhirka . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=Biography
#Text=Qazi Ghulam Mustafa ( died ca 1123 AH / 1711 AD ) was one of the prominent noble men during the Mughal empire .
#Text=Awards and honour
#Text=He was entitled ' Nawab Kar Talab Khan ' meaning " the seeker of challenges " in Persian by Bahadur Shah I [ 5 ] :9

column1: #Text=Bahadur Shah I
#Text=also named as Shah Alam in his first Juloos ( Parade ) on 24 Jumada al-awwal appointed him as ‘ Karoregiri ’ of the royal treasure with an award of Khalat [ 5 ] :19
#Text=Bahadur Shah I
#Text=in his second Juloos on 9 Dhu al-Qi'dah awarded him Mansab Do Hazari ( 2,000 ) , zaat wa sowar . [ 5 ] :40
#Text=In the same year on 15 Dhu al-Qi'dah , the king awarded him the responsibility of ‘ Amanat ’ . [ 5 ] :41
#Text=He was also awarded 3,000 + 5,00 zaat wa sowar [ 5 ] :117
#Text=Death
#Text=He died on 20 Muharram 1129 AH/1716 and buried in Ferozepur Jhirka . [ 6 ]
#Text=In another book , his date of death is mentioned as last days of dhul Hijjah 1122 AH / 1710 AD . [ 1 ]
#Text=However , an epitaph from Ferozepur Jhirka , places the death of Kartalab Khan Bahadur , son of Shaikh Muhammad Asaf in AH 1123 ( AD 1711 ) [ 7 ]
#Text=Family history
#Text=The family of Qazi Ghulam Mustafa came to India from Medina .
#Text=His forefathers , Haji al Harmen Malik Hussain belonged to the family Ansar of Medina Munawwarah , was a prominent man and came to India with his son Bandagi Shaikh Khalil .
#Text=They stayed in Delhi at Masjid Mahal .
#Text=Both father and son were very distinguished scholars of many disciplines .
#Text=Three sons were born to Bandagi Shaikh Khalil in Delhi .
#Text=The elder son was Akhwand Mir , second was Mohammad Ammad and third youngest was Mohammad Zakaria .
#Text=These three brothers were closely attached and ‘ Ba’it ’ by Qazi Shariah .
#Text=These three brothers along with Qazi Shariah went to Mewat and settled there at Jhumrawat .
#Text=In Jhumrawat near the mountain , they are buried near the grave of Qazi Shariah .
#Text=Family of Akhwand Mir and Mohammad Ammad
#Text=The grandson of Akhwand Mir was Abdus Samad ibn Mohammad Nizam .
#Text=Abdus Samad had two sons ; elder was Bandagi Makhdoom Tahir who along with his Uncle Abu Mohammad son of Mohammad Ammad was settled in Ferozepur Jhirka and made it a big estate ( riyasat ) .
#Text=The other son of Abdus Samad , Mohammad Zain was later on settled in Sakras ( Haryana ) .
#Text=Dewan Shaikh Asaf and his father Dewan Maskeen raised both name and fame .
#Text=They were chief revenue officers of a province Mewat and were entitled Dewan by Mughals .
#Text=Dewan Maskeen was the son of Imamuddin ibn Sadr Jahan ibn Adul Malik ibn Abu Mohammad ibn Mohammad Ammad ibn Bandagi Shaikh Khalil .
#Text=Dewan Shaikh Asaf ( also Idris ) was married to Bibi Rabiya , daughter of Noor Munawwar Narkhi ( ibn Mohammad Talib Narkhi ibn Ainuddin ibn Moinuddin ibn Qazi Fatehullah ) .
#Text=Qazi Ghulam Mustafa and Ghulam Husain were two prominent sons of Dewan Shaikh Asaf and Bibi Rabiya .
#Text=The son of Ghulam Husain , Ali Akbar was also entitled by ' Khan ' , while the daughter , Sharfun Nisan was married to Syed Yusuf Ali Khan from ' Syed Sarai ' of Rewari .
#Text=Family of Mohammad Zakaria
#Text=The son of Mohammad Zakaria was Pir Mohammad Najeeb was settled in Bahadurpur ( Haryana ) .
#Text=He was very famous religious sajjada .
#Text=Shah Mohammad Hanif from Bahadurpur belonged to his descendant .
#Text=Marriage and children
#Text=Qazi Ghulam Mustafa was married to Bibi Rasti ( died Dhu al-Qi'dah 1147 AH / 1734 AD ) daughter of Qazi Syed Rafi Mohammad .
#Text=Khan Zaman Khan Ali Asghar
#Text=was his son .

#Text=Nawab Khan Zaman Khan Bahadur Ghalib Jung ' Ali Asghar ' was Mansabdar Punj Hazari ( 5,000 ) Emir and was posted first Khidmat Daroghgi Topkhana , a store of Armory ( military ) at Multan ; Faujdar at Moazamabad ; Naib Subahdar at Azimabad ( Patna ) ; and then Subahdar at Awadh during the reign from Farrukhsiyar to Muhammad Shah . [ 5 ]
#Text=The fort at Ferozepur Jhirka was built by him .
#Text=He died in Shahjahanbad ( Delhi ) on 4 Zil Haj 1155 AH/30 January 1743 . [ 8 ]
#Text=Fatima , the daughter of Qazi Ghulam Mustafa , was married to Abul Fazal , son of Ataullah ibn Noor Munawwar Narkhi .
#Text=One of the daughters of Qazi Syed Rafi Mohammad was married to Qazi Ghulam Mustafa , and another daughter Sahib Daulat was married to Islam Khan V .
